meanings.definition: The state or quality of being nonchalant.
meanings.sent1: Her nonchalances in the face of danger surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: His nonchalances about the upcoming exam worried his friends.
meanings.sent3: The cat's nonchalances towards the mouse made for a comical chase.
meanings.sent4: The nonchalances of the old tree branches swaying in the wind were mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The nonchalances of the toddler as he explored the room were adorable.

meanings.sent1: The nonchalances of the student towards his grades led to poor performance.
meanings.sent2: She showed nonchalances when her favorite show was canceled.
meanings.sent3: The nonchalances of the robot towards the chaos amused the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The nonchalances of the ocean waves crashing against the shore were breathtaking.
meanings.sent5: His nonchalances towards the storm approaching were concerning to his family.
